dialogue.text: Maybe I’ll give Makoto’s mother a call?
Under most pretenses, I probably wouldn’t make my first call to someone I barely know just before nightfall, but she tends to work late anyway so maybe she’s used to it?
Besides, Makoto is pretty much always at the shop anyway and this might give me a good opportunity to be alone with her.
I tap on Maki’s name in my phone and listen to it ring a few times, hoping she picks up.
Hello?
Hey, Maki? This is your daughter’s teacher.
Oh, hey!
Normally, people introduce themselves by their name and not their job over the phone.
Normally, people {i}know{/i} their name to begin with.
Sorry about that.
No need to apologize. I just don't know what to call you.
Just Sensei is fine.
Hmm...Okay, okay. But if you get to go by your job, I want to as well.
You want me to call you...porn salesman?
Beautiful porn salesman preferably, but sure.
I’ll see if I can remember that.
So what’s up? Why are you calling so late?
Did something happen with Makoto?
Nothing in particular. I just wanted to see if you’d like to meet up for coffee or something.
...Coffee?
Yeah. It’s that brown stuff tired people drink.
Sensei, are you asking a married woman out on a date right now?
Yes.
Yes, I suppose I am.
Hah! Well at least you’re up front about it.
I can probably slip away for a little while if you want to meet up at Koi Cafe.
Yeah, that works for me. I’ll start heading over now.
Same here. I’ll see you soon.
Well...She just seems full of energy.
I have to admit, I saw that call ending a little differently once she brought out the “married woman” line.
But I guess it’s not really my place to question her relationship.
I’ll just head over to the cafe and wait for her to get there.
Welcome to Good Burger, home of the Good Burger. Can I take your order?
...What?
It’s a thing. Don’t ask questions.
Sure, Molly.
Can I just get a black coffee? I’m meeting someone here in a few minutes.
Meeting someone? Like...on a date thingy?
Uhh, I guess so.
It’s just Makoto’s mom.
Makoto? Like, glasses Makoto? The Witch of the West Wind?
You gave her a nickname too?...
Of course! And I’ll do my best to not disrupt your date thingy!
As a fellow degenerate, I know just how hard it can be finding love in this day and age. I’m cheering for you, Sir!
Really? I kind of saw this going a little differently.
No, no! Not at all! Go sit down in the corner! I’ll even bring over something special once she gets here.
That’s really considerate of you, Molly. Thanks.
I take a seat near the back wall and wait for Maki to arrive.
I wonder what sort of “special” thing Molly is going to bring over once the time comes?
I hope it’s not anything explosive.
Hey. Sorry it took me so long. I was continuously running into the wall in hopes that all of its atoms aligned at the perfect time, allowing me to pass through it.
That’s probably the strangest intro to a date I’ve ever had the pleasure of hearing.
Such is the life of the newly proclaimed “Beautiful Porn Salesman.”
Oh, right. I forgot that was your nickname now.
Don’t worry. So did I until five seconds ago.
Which is also right around the time that I became acutely aware that I’m still wearing my tracksuit.
You don’t mind, do you?
Not at all. If anything, I think it even accentuates your beauty.
Yeah, they {i}do{/i} look pretty nice in this, don’t they?
Most people beat around the bush when they say that, though.
Heh. Bush.
Is Makoto really related to this woman?
But anyway, thanks for calling me and blah blah blah. It’s not often I get out anymore, which I’m sure you’re able to tell by the get-up.
Oh how I have longed for the days to go out and enjoy my youth once again.
The life of a parent is truly a rough one.
I can imagine. Makoto’s a good girl, though. At least she makes it easy on you.
She does now. But she was miserable as a kid. It was always “I want this. I want that. Buy me an encyclopedia.”
I mean, really? What kind of five year old wants an encyclopedia for their birthday? Ask for a pony or something. Jeez.
Wow. She was like that back then, too?
Oh yeah. Big time. But hey, at least she’s consistent. Right?
And she’s smarter than both her father and me now, so I can’t help but be proud of her.
High maintenance or not, she’ll always be my little girl.
Molly shows up at the table and places a normal cup of coffee in front of Maki.
How is this, in any way, special?
That’s strange. I just felt the atmosphere in here change a little.
It feels...darker in some way.
Well, that’s...
Someone is giving me the death-stare, aren’t they?
Yeah. I think that might be my fault.
Clíodhna, beseech unto me a fraction of your beauty so that I may leave this harlot in the grimy waters of Glandore to {i}drown{/i}.
Uhh, hello there.
Molly, please tell me that the coffee you brought to the table isn't poisoned.
What do you think you're doing here?
Umm...Have I done something to offend you?
State your name and occupation, harlot.
Maki Miyamura. Beautiful porn salesman.
And what exactly is it you intend to do with my master, {i}Maki Miyamura{/i}?
Master?...
I am a ninja and I am teaching Molly how to be a ninja as well.
Wow, you're so cool.
I know.
The two of us were just having some coffee. It’s an entirely wholesome meeting and you’re welcome to join us if you’d like.
I’m afraid I can not. Your aura is suffocating me.
{i}I think this girl might like you.{/i}
I don’t think she’s into actual humans, to tell you the truth.
Never fear. My husband also prefers other types of life forms. There is nothing wrong with it.
You have horrible taste in women, Sir.
This is clearly a succubus and you’ve just been lured into her trap.
It is the only possible explanation.
But do not fear. I shall protect you.
Hey, do you ever stare into the mirror for so long that it starts to look like all of your skin is detaching and floating somewhere else?
Maki, are you on drugs?
What? Who is Maki? Where am I?
Are you my daughter?
Ah!
Maki, stop. You are scaring the employees.
There is money for you in my purse.
Where...is your purse?
Over there. Go get it.
AAAAHHH!
I’LL BE RIGHT BACK!
Molly nervously runs away and Maki refocuses her attention on me.
You’re kind of terrifying.
Yeah. I kind of am.
Years and years of experience. I’m pretty good at figuring out what will set people off.
I feel like skirting the line betweeen dementia and drug addiction is enough to set most people off.
Yeah, well, I'm a free woman and I can do whatever I want.
Not like it matters to me but...aren’t you married?
I am. But it’s one of those “open relationship” deals.
I’m sure my husband is out there in space hugging an alien-girl as we speak.
Is that even possible? Have we confirmed that they have arms?
I don’t know. But he’s a smart man. I’m sure he’ll find a way.
I hear the economy is pretty horrible in space, too. Child support will probably only be a few dollars a month.
What is this conversation turning into?
Hey, {i}you’re{/i} the one who brought up my marriage. I’m just trying to explain the situation to you.
Does Makoto know about the situation?
She...prefers not talking about things like that.
And besides, even though it’s an open relationship, it’s not like I’m passing myself around.
Believe it or not, I don’t really have many friends and-
Yeah, I believe that.
Wait, what? Why did you believe that so easily?
Just the vibe you give off.
It’s like a mix between shut-in, mega-deviant, and doting mother. It’s a strange combination and I can’t imagine it makes it easy to meet people or retain friendships.
Yup. Pretty much hit the nail on the head with that one.
It’s fine, though. If sexual feelings happen, they happen. I’m just not the type to go out and actively search for them with anyone.
Despite working in a porn shop, I could pretty much live without sex if I wanted to.
Obviously doesn’t mean I don’t enjoy it, though.
Well that’s...good news?
I’m not really sure how to respond to Maki right now.
This conversation is walking a fine line between serious and flirty, and it’s sort of putting me on the back foot.
But it’s not like I have a time limit or anything.
I’m sure if the two of us just keep hanging out like this, things are bound to happen eventually.
I just need to make sure Makoto doesn’t find out about it.
So, do you think the red-haired girl is doing okay?
She’s been in the back for a while now.
Molly? I’m sure she’s fine. Just a little worked up.
Sure you don’t want to go check on her?
There are several reasons that I don’t think that would be a good idea right now.
Let’s just finish drinking our coffee and head out.
Hahah~ If that’s what you want, sure.
And then, the two of us do just that.
We sit there like civilized adults, sipping coffee and talking about our respective outlooks and interests.
Maki talks much more than I do.
I just relax and take in as much information as she’s willing to give me.
I’m sure it will come in handy eventually...
{i}Maki’s affection has increased to [maki_love]!{/i}
